DEP4. In adults with moderate-to-severe depressive disorder, what is the effectiveness and safety of antidepressant medicine compared with psychological treatment? Recommendation (update): In adults with moderate-to-severe depression, psychological interventions or combined treatment should be considered based on individual preferences and careful consideration of the balance of benefits and harms. Antidepressant medicine alone for adults with moderate-to-severe depression should only be considered when psychological interventions are not available. Providers should keep in mind the possible adverse effects associated with antidepressant medicines, and individual preferences.
